questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a subroutine (procedure or function) in a program?
questions.mark_scheme: To break down a problem into smaller, reusable sections of code
questions.subtopic: Structure of programs — procedures and functions
questions.wrong_choices: ["To increase the size of the compiled program", "To ensure that the program runs faster", "To make the program harder to debug"]

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a parameter passed by value?
questions.mark_scheme: A copy of the data is passed to the subroutine
questions.subtopic: Parameters — passing by value and reference
questions.wrong_choices: ["The subroutine can modify the original variable", "The address of the data is passed to the subroutine", "The data is always stored in global memory"]

questions.question: What is the output of the expression 5 DIV 2 in most high-level languages?
What is the meaning of the term “concatenation” in programming?
questions.wrong_choices: ["Breaking a string into individual characters", "Reversing the order of characters in a string", "Converting a string to uppercase"]

questions.question: Which statement about recursion is true?
questions.wrong_choices: ["A recursive subroutine can only call other subroutines", "A recursive subroutine cannot contain parameters", "Recursion is faster than iteration in all cases"]

questions.question: What is the effect of declaring a variable as local in a subroutine?
questions.mark_scheme: It can only be accessed within that subroutine
questions.wrong_choices: ["It can be accessed from anywhere in the program", "It shares memory with a global variable of the same name", "It persists after the subroutine finishes"]

questions.question: Which data type would be most suitable to represent True or False values?
Which of these control structures is used for selection?
What does the term “iteration” refer to in programming?
questions.mark_scheme: The repeated execution of a block of code
questions.wrong_choices: ["The breaking down of code into smaller modules", "The declaration of variables", "The conditional branching of code"]

questions.question: In pseudocode, what does LEN(string) return?
questions.mark_scheme: The number of characters in the string
questions.wrong_choices: ["The string converted to uppercase", "The first character of the string", "The string in reverse order"]

questions.question: Explain the difference between passing a parameter by value and passing it by reference.
questions.mark_scheme: ["Passing by value means a copy of the data is given to the subroutine.", "Passing by reference means the subroutine receives a reference to the original variable.", "Changes in a pass-by-reference parameter affect the original variable.", "Changes in a pass-by-value parameter do not affect the original variable."]
questions.subtopic: Parameters — passing by value and reference

questions.question: Describe two advantages of using subroutines in a program.
questions.mark_scheme: ["Subroutines allow code reuse, reducing duplication.", "They make programs easier to read and maintain.", "They help in breaking down complex problems into smaller parts.", "They allow multiple programmers to work on different parts of a program."]
questions.subtopic: Structure of programs — procedures and functions

questions.question: Explain what is meant by the term recursion and describe a potential drawback of using recursion in a program.
questions.mark_scheme: ["Recursion is when a subroutine calls itself.", "Each recursive call creates a new stack frame.", "Recursion can lead to stack overflow if the base case is not reached.", "Recursion can be less efficient than iteration due to overhead of multiple function calls."]

questions.question: State what is meant by the scope of a variable, and explain the difference between a local and a global variable.
questions.mark_scheme: ["Scope refers to where a variable can be accessed in a program.", "A local variable can only be accessed within the subroutine or block where it is declared.", "A global variable can be accessed from anywhere in the program.", "Local variables reduce the chance of unintended side effects."]

questions.mark_scheme: ["Finding the length of a string (e.g., LEN).", "Extracting a substring (e.g., MID or SUBSTRING).", "Changing case (e.g., converting to uppercase or lowercase).", "Finding the position of a character or substring within a string."]
